byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from Los Angeles, and Julia Preston from New York.
byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and JULIA PRESTON

abstract: San Francisco Mayor Edward M Lee says he will examine how city can participate in Obama administration's deportation program; city has been criticized for releasing Mexican felon Juan Francisco Lopez-Sanchez, who has been deported five times, from jail without alerting federal authorities; Lopez-Sanchez was later charged with murdering Kathryn Steinle on tourist pier.
lead_paragraph: The handgun used by a Mexican immigrant to fatally shoot a woman on a pier last week was stolen in June from the vehicle of a Bureau of Land Management agent.

headline.main: After Killing Tied to Deported Felon, San Francisco Mayor Mulls Policy Shift
headline.print_headline: After Killing Tied to Deported Felon, San Francisco Mayor Mulls Policy Shift

snippet: The handgun used by a Mexican immigrant to fatally shoot a woman on a pier last week was stolen in June from the vehicle of a Bureau of Land Management agent.
